column4: Hi all, I am having trouble detecting my hard drive. I am doing an
alternate install because of this. How do I find out which disk
driver I need?
sorry for the multi-line
are you sure it's not your controller you need driver for? what kind of special drive do you have?
om26er: It is detected by Windows 7, but not by Ubuntu 10.04. It is a WD Sata2 drive. And I might need a controller driver, I don't know.
focus on finding out what controller you have and see if you have multiple controllers, move the drive to one that is supported by linux.
You mean go into the machine and switch the plug? It is on controller 0, I think. Is that what you mean?
yes.
So the BIOS sees Controller 1-6 (including #3, the DVD). I need to move the WD from controller 0 to controller 1?
you seem to be talking about ports, not controller. If you have an onboard ICH controller try switching it to AHCI-mode in bios.
I did that
It is in AHCI mode now.
I doubt it'll help to move between ports on the same controller.
I'm not a hardware guy. You're right, I was talking about ports.
Can you help further?
not really. I've given you the hints I would use myself.
Fair enough. I am confused whether you thought I should go in and mess with the hardware?
whether I thought it, or why I thought it?
if you connected the drive to some 2 channel special controller on the motherboard it would have made sense to move it to the main 6channel controller, but you already did that so...
I haven't played with the innards. I bought the box today.
